courses.title: Diagnostic Imaging Physics
courses.description: Physics and image formation methods for conventional X-ray CT, nuclear medicine, and magnetic resonance and ultrasound imaging.

courses.title: Seminar in Medical Physics I
courses.description: Weekly 1-hour seminar on topics related to medical physics.

courses.title: Seminar in Medical Physics II
courses.description: Weekly 1-hour seminar on topics related to medical physics.

courses.title: Nuclear Medicine Physics
courses.description: Radioisotope production, radiopharmacy, planar gamma cameras, SPECT systems, PET systems, medical internal radiation dose (MIRD) method, nuclear medicine facilities and regulations.

courses.title: Radiation Therapy Physics
courses.description: Clinical radiation oncology, phantom systems, radiation machines, photon beams, electron beams, brachythearpy, dose modeling and treatment planning.

courses.title: Radiation Therapy Treatment Planning Laboratory
courses.description: Radiation therapy treatment planning course covering conventional radiation therapy treatment planning, monitor unit calculations, and advanced radiation treatment planning techniques.

courses.title: Radiation Therapy Physics
courses.description: Measurement and calculation of absorbed dose, dose distributions, treatment planning, photon teletherapy, electron teletherapy, brachytherapy, clinical linear accelerators, quality assurance.

courses.title: Radiological Anatomy
courses.description: A survey of the most clinically relevant anatomy as visualized by modern diagnostic imaging; plan radiographs, CT, MRI, and PET are emphasized.

courses.title: Medical Health Physics
courses.description: Basics of medical health physics, Title 10, U.S. Code of Federal Regulations, Parts 19, 20 and 35, shielding for hospital radiation facilities.

courses.title: Radiation Dosimetry
courses.description: Dosimetry of ionizing radiation: photons, neutrons, and charged particles; cavity theory; concept of exposure and absorbed dose; ion chambers and other types of integration dosimeters.

courses.title: Applications of the Monte Carlo Method in Medical Physics
courses.description: Basic principles of the Monte Carlo method, Monte Carlo transport of photon and electron, various applications of the Monte Carlo method in medical physics.

courses.title: Radiation Protection and Dosimetry
courses.description: Radiation dosimetry quantities, calculational and experimental methods for assessing the absorbed dose, effective dose assessment, committed effective dose assessment, radiation shielding methods.

courses.title: Radiation Dosimetry & Protection
courses.description: Introduction to the calculation of radiation dose, dosimetry, and health physics.

courses.title: Radiation Biology and Oncology
courses.description: Radiation lesions and repair, mechanisms of cell death, cell cycle effect, radiation sensitizers and protectors, tumor radiobiology, relative sensitivities of human tissues, and radiation carcinogenesis.

courses.title: Radiation Physics
courses.description: Characteristics of atomic and nuclear radiation, transition probabilities, radioactivity abd isotopes, cross sections, electromagnetic radiation, neutrons, and charges particle interaction with matter.  Crosslisted with NRE 6756 and HP 6756.

courses.title: Radiation Detection
courses.description: Introduction to the theory and application of radiation detectors, measurement methods, signal processing, and data analysis.  Crosslisted with HP 6757 and NRE 6757.

courses.title: Radiation Shielding Principles and Analysis
courses.description: Principles of Radiation Shielding; Design of Shields; Computational Methods for Analysis of Shielding; Emphasis on Monte Carlo Simulation as a Shielding Tool.

courses.title: Seminar in Medical Physics I
courses.description: Weekly one hour seminars on topics related to medical physics.

courses.title: Seminar in Medical Physics II
courses.description: Weekly one hour seminar on topics related to medical physics.

courses.title: Seminars in Medical Physics
courses.description: Seminars involving current research projects presented by graduate students, faculty, and invited speakers.

courses.title: Clinical Rotations in Medical Physics
courses.description: Four hundred supervised contact hours of clinical internship in diagnostic imaging, nuclear medicine, and radiation oncology at the affiliated clinical facilities.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Special topics offerings of current interest in medical physics not included in regular courses.
